title: Giovanni Pastrone
brief_description: Giovanni Pastrone was a director, producer, actor and inventor who pioneered the use of diffused lighting, panoramas, grandiose sets, miniature models and a moving camera. All of these elements were on show in his epic 1914 film, Cabiria.

constellations_primary.name: Tracking cinema
constellations_primary.description: A constellation looking at the evolution of the tracking / dolly shot.

description: Giovanni Pastrone was a director, producer, actor and inventor who pioneered the use of diffused lighting, panoramas, grandiose sets, miniature models and a moving camera. All of these elements were on show in his epic 1914 film, Cabiria. The film broke new artistic ground by using special effects to re-create the eruption of Mount Etna and the naval battle of Syracuse, but its biggest legacy is the ‘Cabiria’ shot: the tracking shot. Pastrone mounted a camera on a dolly to trail the action in a scene, and this new technique was quickly adopted by filmmakers at the time.
